She began her business because she needed to create an income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price fluctuations.

Ya Alimamy requires a loan in order to buy more wood to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her family's welfare. In the future, Ya Alimamy plans to change her business to a big provision shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Cesia Lili

texts.es:
Cesia es una joven de 21 años,  es bachiller contador , soltera con planes de casarse  Ceci vive  con sus padres y 5 hermanos.

Cesia es maestra, dándoles clases a niños; desde hace tres años en una  ONGs sin fines de lucro. Ella fue parte de este proyecto cuando estaba pequeña y vieron la capacidad y la dejaron como maestra,  ella trabaja de las 8 a las 4 de la tarde hace 30 minutos de la casa al trabajo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, a Fundación Campo, es para pagar los gastos de su boda, como: la comida, invitaciones, alquiler del local, etc. 

El sueño de Cesia es tener una familia muy digna, con principios, cuando ya vengan los hijos y seguir trabajando para darles una buena vida.
texts.en:
Cesia, 21, is a young woman, single but she is planning to get married. She finished high school with an accounting profile and lives with her parents and five siblings.

Cesia works as a teacher. She has been teaching children for three years at a non-for-profit NGO. She was actually part of this project when she was little and showed good skills to become a teacher. She works from 8 am to 4 pm. It takes her 30 minutes to go from work to home.

She is requesting a loan at Fundación Campo to pay for her wedding’s expenses: food, invitations, renting a place, etc.

Cesia’s dream is to have a respectable family, with principles. When children come, she will continue working in order to offer them a good life.

loans.use: to pay for her wedding's expenses: food, invitations, renting the place, etc.

loans.name: Dominga Isabel

texts.es: Dominga de 44 años de edad  desde hace 14 años posee un negocio de venta de hielo y charamuscas en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela ya que es un alimento muy vendible y por la higiene que tiene cuando los prepara, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, Dominga está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar todos los ingredientes necesarios para seguir preparando los alimentos como: frutas, azúcar, colorantes, cebadas, horchatas, bolsas, etc. y así seguir con su negocio que le ha generado muy buenas ganancias y poderle dar a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Dominga, 44, has worked selling ice and charamuscas [frozen juice] at home for fourteen years. She has many customers, since what she sells is highly demanded and she prepares them with high hygiene standards. She lives with her husband and two children in a house of their own.

Dominga is requesting a loan to buy the necessary ingredients to continue preparing her foods: fruits, sugar, food coloring, cebadas and horchatas [traditional beverages], plastic bags, etc. This way, she will continue working with her business, which has given her good profits, in order to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fruits, sugar, food coloring, traditional beverages, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Sumac Wata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAC WATA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Senovia ella es soltera y tiene 48 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, la socia vende manzanas,naranjas,uvas,platanos y mandarinas, la socia también vende zanahorias, tomates y pepinos, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las frutas y verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas y verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas, plátanos, uvas, cebollas, zanahorias y pepinos.

La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su cara ya no pertenece al banco comunal Sumac Wata
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de leche, negocio de venta de quesos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “SUMAC WATA” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cuzco, in the province and department of Cuzco. 

Senovia is a member. She is 48 years old, single, and the mother of 2 children. She works in her business selling vegetables and fruit. She sells apples, oranges, grapes, plantains and tangerines. She also sells carrots, tomatoes and cucumbers. She has a stall in the market where she sells the fruits and vegetables and works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. This members has had this business for 7 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell the fruits and vegetables. She is asking for the loan to buy oranges, plantains, grapes, onions, carrots and cucumbers. 

The member who is covered with a circle on her face doesn't belong to the Sumac Wata communal bank.  
 
The other members have businesses selling milk, selling cheese, a convenience store and selling food. 

This member is grateful to those who have been a part of her dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy oranges, plantains, grapes, onions, carrots and  cucumbers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, beverages, snacks, oils, eggs, toilet paper, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Nora

texts.es: Doña Rosa de 57 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su hija, su nieta y su yerno, Rosa es una madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas, huevos y también de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en: Rosa is 57 years old. She lives in her own house with her daughter, her granddaughter and her son in law. Rosa is a very responsible and hardworking mother. She has been able to get her family ahead. She has a store where she sells edible products such as bread, beverages, oils, vegetables, fruits, snacks, and eggs. She also sells staples such as soap, shampoo and more. The business is in her house. She is asking for a loan to stock her store even more so she can serve more customers and improve her sales, which is her priority for getting her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy bread, beverages, oils, vegetables, fruits, snacks, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Amélé est une femme célibataire âgée de 40ans. Elle est revendeuse de céréales, de farine de manioc, de bananes plantain à toutes personnes. Elle exerce son activité au marché et a commencé depuis 2000. Elle sollicite son premier prêt pour réinvestir dans le commerce de céréales, de farine de manioc et de bananes plantains. Elle espère créer une usine de fabrication de farine de manioc et mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en: Amélé is a single, 40-year-old woman. She is a reseller of cereals, cassava flour and plantains, which she sells to all types of customers. She started her business in 2000 and makes her sales at the market. She is requesting her first loan in order to invest it in her business selling cereals, cassava flour and plantains. She hopes to create a cassava flour production plant and become more self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy cereals and plantains.

loans.name: Fifonsi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFONSI est composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Philomène (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 55 ans. Philomène a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Philomène est mariée à un certain Corneille. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Philomène vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour ce faire, Philomène vend du maïs, du haricot et du charbon de bois dans sa région depuis douze ans. Philomène s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Philomène s’associe aux autres membres du groupe FIFONSI pour solliciter un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Fifonsi group has 5 members who all live in the same district. The group's representative, Philomène (the one with her hand raised in the picture), is 55 years old. Philomène left school at secondary level. She is married to Corneille. The couple have 2 dependent children who both attend school. Philomène lives with her husband and children. The couple both cover the various household expenses. In order to be able to do this, Philomène has been selling corn, beans and charcoal in her area for 12 years. Philomène gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In order to strengthen her business, Philomène is joining with the other members of the Fifonsi group to request a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and charcoal.

loans.name: Burulsun

texts.ru: Бурулсун 50 лет. Совместно с супругом воспитывают троих детей. В 1996 году, супруги начали бизнес в торговле посудой с арендованного контейнера, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 15,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Бурулсун имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, супруги смогли сделать ремонт дома и построить забор. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Бурулсун обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для оптовой покупки посуды ежедневного пользования для последующей розничной торговли. Доходы от кредита Бурулсун планирует вложить в увеличение товарооборота и накопить деньги на покупку автомашины.
texts.en: Burulsun is 50 years old. Together with her husband, she is raising three children. In 1996, the couple started their own business of selling dishes from a rental container. She started this business with initial start-up capital in the amount of 15,000 som (KGS). Having been able to develop her business and attract loyal customers, Burulsun has an average monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to the hard work put into their business, the couple has been able to make home repairs and put up a fence. For the purpose of further increasing and expanding her business, Burulsun turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for a wholesale purchase of everyday use dishes for subsequent retail sale. Burulsun plans to invest the earnings from the loan to increase sales turnover. She also intends to save money to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy dishes wholesale for subsequent retail sale.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза родилась в 1992 года. Она трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она замужем, но не имеет детей. Наргиза является студенткой 1 курса Худжандского Государственного Университета. Она учится в факультете Русская филология. Наргиза мечтает после окончания университета стать учительницей русского языка и преподавать в школе. Она очень любит профессию учителя и довольно, тем, что она поступила на педагогический факультет. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и не отправил денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nargiza was born in 1992. She is a hardworking and cheerful woman. She is married but does not have children. Nargiza is a first year student at Khujand State University. She is studying in the Russian language department. Nargiza dreams of becoming a Russian language teacher after graduating from university and teaching in a school. She really loves the teaching profession, so much so that she joined the pedagogical department. She needs to pay for her tuition, but her husband is a labor migrant in the Russian Federation and has not sent money home. She is requesting a loan to pay for her university tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Saodatkhon

texts.ru: Саодатхону 47 лет. Несколько лет назад ее муж умер, и ей было очень трудно справляться с семейными расходами, так как от мужа ей не досталось ничего. Она кормилица  3 детей. Она свет в жизни детей и единственная надежда для них. Она более 4 года работает в банке техничкой. Саодатхон и ее дети живут бедно. Она выдала замуж свою дочь. Ее дочь недавно родила ребенка. Саодатхон по национальным обычаям должна провести торжество «чилагурезон» и купить много подарков для новорожденного. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  5000 сомони для проведения торжества.  Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Saodatkhon is 47 years old. Several years ago, her husband died and she had a really hard time coping with her family's expenses, as she was left nothing from her husband. She is the sole provider to three children. Her children are the light of her world and she is their rock. For more than four years, she has worked in a bank as a cleaning woman. Saodatkhon and her children live in poor living conditions. She gave away her daughter in marriage. Her daughter recently had a baby. According to national tradition, Saodatkhon needs to throw a celebration called "Chilagurezon" and buy many gifts for the newborn. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to throw this celebration. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: To throw a traditional celebration for her newborn grandchild.

loans.name: Gbassary

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 43-year-old Gbassary from the Waterloo eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with three children between the ages 7 and 20; two of her children are attending school. 

Gbassary runs a cookery business at home; she sells cooked food. She has been running this business since 2009. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Gbassary says that the main challenges to her business are prices, transportation, and insufficient financing to expand her business.

Gbassary has requested a loan to buy more cooking items like rice, onions, and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, onions, and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo, in the western rural area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of 6 and 13; her children are currently attending school. 

Fatmata established her seamstress business nine years ago. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is sometimes slow payment from customers.

Fatmata requires a loan to buy new machines and fabric to expand her sewing business.  She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business, and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy new machines and fabric to expand her sewing business.

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Mbalu from Waterloo's western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children; two of her children are currently attending school. 

For the past 15 years, Mbalu has had a pharmacy business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient financing to expand her business. 

Mbalu requires a loan to buy more malarial drugs, cool syrup (a syrup for colds), and blood syrup (a herbal medicine for anemia) to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, Mbalu plans to change her business to a big pharmacy shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more malarial drugs, cool syrup, and blood syrup expand her business.

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es: Silvia de 34 años de edad vive en casa  propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas plátanos, zanahorias, tomates, cebollas, chiles entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; Silvia es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor,  tiene buenas referencias de pago, esta agradecida con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Silvia, 34, lives with her husband and two children in a house of their own. She sells fruits, plantains, carrots, tomatoes, onions and chilies, among other things. She has worked with this for a couple of years, which has helped her gain great experience in sales and receive more profits. She sells in a strategic location for her type of activity. The place where she works is busy with people and she has many customers that prefer her fresh, good-quality produce, her prices and the excellent service she offers.

Silvia is an enterprising woman, devoted to her job and with a strong will to get ahead. She is always looking for alternatives that can help her be successful. Lately, the demand has increased, so she wants to take advantage of this situation to make a new investment. However, she does not have enough capital to support her investment and this is why she is requesting a loan at INTEGRAL. She will buy fruits and vegetables in bulk. She has a good payment record and appreciates the support she is receiving. She promises to pay back the loan and believes she will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Alijon

texts.ru: Аличону 40 лет. Он женат. Аличон ответственный отец 2 детей. У него одна дочь и один сын. Аличон занимается скотоводством. Он постепенно развевает свой бизнес и таким образом зарабатывает на жизнь. Аличон выделяет огромное внимание на образование своих детей. Его дочь учится в медицинском колледже. Его сын в этом году поступил  в Горно - металлургический университет. Он учится по специальности энерго- механик. Он активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. Аличон должен оплатить за учебный договор своего сына и с такой целью он обратился за займом. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Alijon is 40 years old, he is married. Alijon is a responsible father of two children. He has one daughter and one son. Alijon does animal husbandry. He gradually grows his business and by that makes a living. Alijon pays a great amount of attention to the education of his children. His daughter is studying in the medical college. His son has enrolled in a mining and metallurgical university. He is majoring in mechanical energy. He actively takes part in the social life of the university. Alijon has to pay for the tuition of his son and has come for the loan with this purpose. He hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for education of his son.

loans.name: Mahalaxmi Group

texts.en:
Pushpabati,  aged about 52, is a member of a group from Bissam Cuttack town situated in Rayagada district of Odisha state in India. Her family is comprised of three members, she and her two sons aged 31 and 34. The member standing on the right with raised hand is Pushpabati. At present her two sons are running an electronics items shop in her locality. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income out of her own efforts.

Pushpabati  got her first loan from Mahashakti during 2010. It is the third time she is taking out a loan for development of her existing business.  At present, her family income is about Rs.10,000 per month. 

To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income, she wants to access a loan.  From the loan she will purchase a fridge, TV, a cooler and other electronics items for her shop. She has a dream to expand her business and wants to be a wholesaler in her small town by maintaining different varieties of items.

The other member is Sagarika, with a  fast food centre in the town.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge, TV, and a cooler and other electronics items for her shop

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is the featured borrower of this group. She came together with her group member to acquire a total loan amount of GHS 2700 from Kiva's partner, ID-Ghana, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Rebecca is a 58-year-old widowed mother of one child. She has been selling vegetables and cooking oil at her residence for eight years. Her child is at the high school level. He is 20 years old and sometimes assists his mother in the sale of items. That's why she is acquiring a loan amount of GHS 1600 from Kiva's partner, ID-Ghana, to buy fresh vegetables and oil from the wholesale market and sell them to her customers.

Rebecca is on the left in the picture. As for Ashami, she sells smoked fish.

loans.use: To buy fresh vegetables and oil from the wholesale market for resale.

loans.name: America

texts.en:
America is a married woman and a mother of three children from San Miguel, Bohol. She earns a living through her clothing sales. This is the source of her income.

America is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like shirts, pants, blouses, children's wear, fashion accessories and others. With this, she will be able to attract more buyers thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, America has hopes of making her business a success and a stable source of income so that she can help her husband in supporting the needs of the family especially the school expenses of their children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like shirts, pants, blouses, children's wear, fashion accessories and others

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 23-year-old Aminata from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children. She began her business because she wants to be independent. In 2010, Aminata established her general store business.  She works at the business from 8 am to 12 pm, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, juice and Pure Water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to expand her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Aminata plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, juice and Pure Water

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Haja from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children. She began her business because she wants to take care of her family's welfare. In 2010, Haja established her retail business.  She works at the business from 8 am to 12 pm, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Haja requires a loan in order to purchase more items like stout and beer  to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to expand her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Haja plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like stout and beer  to expand her business.

loans.name: Anania

texts.en:
Anania is a married woman and a mother of five grown-up children from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in the hog raising business for more than two years now. Her husband works as a farmer.

Anania is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and more animal feed. With this, she will  be able to grow healthy pigs which she can sell, thus augmenting her income and savings.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and more animal feed

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 67 years old, and married with nine children. His children are all married and he only lives with two children who are orphans. He carries out cattle fattening as his major business income and farming on the side. He started the business to enhance his income levels. He always sells milk to local community members which enables him to earn daily income, hence enabling him to support his family. He is taking this loan to buy more cows so as to increase on the liters to increase his income.

The client faces various challenges, mostly cow diseases and cattle thieves, but with all that he has managed to persevere to have a sound business. The client recommends UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the financial assistance which has enabled him to improve his standards of living.

loans.use: To buy cattle for fattening

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Abibatu from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with eight children.  Twenty years ago, Abibatu established her palm oil business and her cassava bread business at her house. She began her business because that way, she generates her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Abibatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and expand her business. In the future, Abibatu plans to expand her business still more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали 37 лет, он женат, проживает в городе Дангара. У него три сына в возрасте 9, 5, 3 лет и одна семилетняя дочь. Сафарали 5 лет работал учителем в родной деревне, учителем таджикского языка и литературы. На зарплату учителя он не смог покрыть семейные расходы и по этой причине занялся продажей фруктов. Его бизнесу уже 6 лет. Он начинал работать с братом, чтобы научиться маркетингу. Теперь работает один, но ему не скучно, потому что покупатели состоящие из его соседей и близко живущих не дают ему скучать. Сафарали приятно проводит время и приносит пользу в семейный бюджет. Он собирается закупить больше сезонных фруктов и пополнить свои запасы. Для этого закупа он просит кредит. Когда у него будет товар, Сафарали надеется его удачно продать, тем самым получить доход и провести ремонт в доме. Сафарали готовиться к зиме и заботиться о своих детях. Помогите Сафарали!
texts.en: Safarali is 37 years old, married and lives in the city of Dangara. He has three sons who are 9, 5, and 3 years old and a 7-year-old daughter. For five years, Safarali worked as a teacher of Tajik language and literature in his home town. He was not able to cover his family's expenses on a teacher's salary, which is why he took up fruit selling. His business is already six years old. He began his work with his brother so that he could learn marketing. Now he works alone, but he is not bored as his customers are his neighbors, and those who live close to him do not let him get bored. Safarali enjoys spending his time this way and brings something beneficial to his family's budget. He plans to buy more seasonal fruit and restock his supplies. He is requesting a loan for this purchase. When he gets his products, Safarali hopes to successfully sell them and thereby receive earnings and start repairs on his house. Safarali is getting ready for winter and is concerned about his children. Please help Safarali!

loans.use: to buy new products (seasonal fruits) to increase sales turnover and, using the profits, start repair on his home.

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen is a married woman and a mother of five children who are still attending school. She is engaged in the retail business selling various goods and items to the people in her place.

Arlen is asking for a loan to buy more groceries for her store such canned goods, noodles, bread and snack foods, candies, soda, coffee, sugar, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater for more buyers in her store thus augmenting her sales and income. Arlen wants to expand her business in the future so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family especially for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store such canned goods, noodles, bread and snack foods, candies, soda, coffee, sugar, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Ceriaca

texts.en: Ceriaca is a resident of Trinidad, Bohol. She earns a living through her 'sari-sari' or variety store business. She sells various goods and items, mainly food, to the people in her place. Ceriaca is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, snack foods, chips, sugar, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to cater for more buyers in her store thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, snack foods, chips, sugar, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children.  In 2007, Kadiatu established her snack business. She began her business because she wants to educate her children.  She works at the business from 4:00 pm until 10:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that her business is doing well because out of the profit she is able to survive with her children.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking seasonings, cooking oil and flour to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking seasonings, cooking oil and flour to expand her business.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a vegetable vendor from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and has children to support for schooling. Conchita has been in the business for more than seven years now. 

Conchita is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell such as squash, onions and garlic, carrots, taro, and potatoes among others. Through this loan, she will be able to cater for more buyers in her store thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Conchita has hopes of making her business a success so that it will generate more income and she can then continue supporting her children's education.

loans.use: loan to buy more vegetables to sell such as squash, onions and garlic, carrots, taro, and potatoes among others

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 44-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children aged between 13 years and 25 years. In 2003, Kadiatu established her charcoal business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price changes.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy more bags of charcoal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Kadiatu plans to change her business to a big provisions shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 33-year-old Isatu from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with one child aged 13 years. In 2003, Isatu established her charcoal business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price changes.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more bags of charcoal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a vehicle to transport her goods. In the future; Isatu plans to change her business to a big provisions shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy more bags of charcoal to expand her business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman and a mother of seven children from Trinidad, Bohol. She is engaged in a fishing business with her husband. This is their main source of income.

Cristina is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Cristina has hopes of making their fishing business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Challote's Group

texts.en:
Challote is the featured borrower of this group. She came together with her group members to acquire a total loan amount of GHS 3200 from Kiva's partner, ID-Ghana, because they have always been neighbors and friends. Challote is a 34-year-old married mother of two children. She has been selling fish and onions at her residence for five years. Her children are school-going ages. That's why she is acquiring a loan amount of GHS 1800 from Kiva's partner, ID-Ghana, to buy two cartons of fish and also onions from the harbor and market respectively, smoke the fish and sell it to customers. 

Challote is on the left in the picture. As for Susuana and Diana, they sell cutlery sets and mineral (soft) drinks respectively. They are showcasing samples of what they sell in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy two cartons of fish to smoke and also onions to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman and a mother of two children ages 11 and 6. She lives with her family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. Elvira earns a living through her food vending business. She sells home cooked snack foods to the people in her place.

Elvira is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients used in making banana snacks like sugar, oil, bananas and others. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more banana snacks thus augmenting her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients used in making banana snacks like sugar, oil, bananas and others

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 38 años de edad es una mujer  muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Teresa desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida quien le ayuda en los gastos de su hogar y sus tres hijos,  ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobre todo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y así ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Teresa, who is 38, is a very responsible woman whose main priority is providing for her family.  She works selling tortillas every lunchtime and evening.  She runs her business from her home.  Teresa would very much like to be able to improve her business, as it provides a steady income which enables her to provide for her family.  She lives in her own home with her life partner (who helps her with the household expenses) and her three children.  She is applying for a loan to buy corn and lime so that she can produce a greater quantity of tortillas.  This is particularly important at weekends demand rises because many other tortilla stalls are closed.  Her aim is to boost her income which will enable her to become more financially stable.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk and lime

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Memunatu from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children. She is very hard-working and desires to educate her children. In 2010, Memunatu established her local foodstuffs business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Memunatu requires a loan in order to purchase more bananas, oranges and coconuts. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, Memunatu plans to export her goods. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, oranges and coconuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of yams, maize and rice

loans.name: Evella

texts.en:
Evella is a fish vendor from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a widow and has been in the business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Evella is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. With this, she will be able to sell more fish to the people in her place and augment her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Bernard is a repeat borrower, aged 57 years old, and a resident of Kishororo in rural Ntungamo district. He is married and has six children. 

Bernard applied for a loan of UGX. 1,500,000 to improve his farming business. He still has a challenge of little business turnover from his coffee and low purchases from customers, so he decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to expand on his coffee business by buying in bulk from the rural farmers and then selling to the factory at a higher price. This will help him to make more income so that he can meet his family's needs adequately. In the photograph is Benard (left) and the UGAFODE staff in a tie (right).

loans.use: To buy additional coffee in bulk to sell to the factory for a profit

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Dorah from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She single with one child. She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant. In 2010, Dorah established her clothing business.  She works at the business from 12 hours per day, moving around the community to introduce her clothing business, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Dorah requires a loan in order to purchase more items like lengths of wax cotton for resale;   She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Dorah plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like lengths of wax cotton for resale

loans.name: Mayra Esperanza

texts.es: Mayra, tiene 28 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene un hijo y reside en el municipio de San Marcos, Santa Bárbara. Hace 5 años  se dedica a la venta de ropa para niño y adulto (camisas, jeans, short, blusas, ropa interior, etc.) esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante. El préstamo que ha solicitado es el cuarto ciclo y es por 6,000 Lempiras, el cual lo va invertir en la compra de más ropa usada como camisetas, pantalones, blusas, y ropa intima para la venta, ya que así podrá obtener más ganancias. Su  meta es aumentar la variedad de ropa, poder vender en otras zonas y así poder mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Mayra, who is 28, lives with her partner and their son in the town of San Marcos, in Santa Barbara department.  Five years ago, she started selling children's and adult clothing (shirts, jeans, shorts, blouses, underwear, etc.) in the street. The loan which she has applied for is her fourth loan cycle and is for 6,000 lempiras.  She will invest it in the purchase of used clothing such as t-shirts, trousers, blouses and underwear to sell, which will enable her to boost her income.  Her ambition is to stock a wider range of clothing, to be able to sell it over a wider area and, ultimately, improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell: shirts, trousers, blouses and underwear.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Salamatu from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children. She was a housewife but she began this business to create income to support her parent. In 1995, Salamatu established her general store business.  She works at the business from 8 am to 12 pm, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenge to her business is that during the rainy season, sales are very slow. 

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, juice and Pure Water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's living conditions and provide shelter for her family. In the future, Salamatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, juice and Pure Water.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 43-year-old Salamatu from Waterloo in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has five children. For the past 20 years, Salamatu has been selling palm oil. She began her business in order to generate her own income. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil

loans.name: Fotimakhon

texts.ru: Фотимахон с детства любила гулять по паркам и наслаждаться красотой природы своей родины. Фотимахону 23 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она студентка 2 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Искусства. Фотимахон в университете учится отлично и активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. Фотимахон учится по специальности менеджмент туризма. Она из не богатой семьи. Ее родители не в состоянии оплатить за ее учебный договор. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора.
texts.en: Since childhood, Fotimakhon has loved to stroll through parks and enjoy the beautiful nature of her homeland. Fotimakhon is 23 years old. She is unmarried and lives with her parents. She is a second-year student at Tajik State University of the Arts. Fotimakhon is doing very well with her studies and actively participates in social life at her university. Fotimakhon studies in the department of tourism management. She is not from a wealthy family. Her parents are not in a position to pay for her university tuition. She is requesting a loan to pay for her tuition.

loans.use: To pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Javzanpagam

texts.en:
Mrs. Javzanpagam, 24 years old, lives with her husband and her father in an old brick house on fenced land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She began working as CEO assistant at a financial institution in 2012 and eventually become a loan officer, increasing her salary amount and earning respect among her colleagues. Her father has retired from work and gets a state pension. 

The house her family lives in has never been renovated since it was built., so she is requesting a loan of 7,700,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, fiberglass and foam to renovate her house in preparation for the coming winter. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating and fewer pollutants are released into the air. The borrower is a very hardworking young woman who cares very much her husband and father.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Ganbaatar, 48 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods between districts within the capital using his own small truck for quite a while. His wife works at a filling station. Their son studies at university. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some renovation, so he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy necessary building materials such as cement, hardwood floors, vacuum-insulated windows and fiberglass. Using those materials, he will repair and renovate his house thus creating a comfortable and warm place for his family. Also the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and release fewer pollutants into air, a contribution to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate his old house

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Isidro has been farming the Tlaxcalan high plains for decades. Although his farm is decidedly "low-tech", he is enthusiastic about trying new ideas and practices if they can help him improve his dairy farm. His cows produce a significant amount of manure per day which he will be able to convert into renewable biogas and potent biofertilizer through his 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

His family will use biogas to cook and heat water using the two burners and stove included in the Biobolsa kit and the biofertilizer will improve Isidro's crop yields without him having to purchase expensive, environmentally-damaging agrochemical fertilizer. By using his digester, he will better use the animal waste on-site, transforming it from waste to multiple resources. He'll save money while concurrently reducing his farm's negative impact on the environment in the form of greenhouse gas emissions, soil degradation, and fossil fuel usage. This loan represents 45% of the total price of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and stove

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn started working at a Catholic private school called Queen of Angels Academy in 1977 as a teacher and later became principal in 1999. In June 2012, she decided to take it over when the diocese wanted to close the school, renaming it Affirmation Academy. Now, nearly 37 years later, Everlyn is managing the school of 70 students, grades K-8, with many of the same staff who started working with her at Queen of Angels.

Everlyn is a passionate educator. She received her Bachelor’s degree in urban education from Rutgers University and later her Master’s in administration and supervision from St. Peters University. After graduation, she decided to stay and work in her neighborhood of Newark, NJ.

Affirmation Academy, Everlyn describes, is challenging and academic-focused. The school utilizes an integrated literacy-based curriculum, and is unique in that it provides an inclusive, caring environment without excusing laziness. Classes are small, with fewer than 15 students in each. Students are encouraged to give back to their community as well.

Eventually, Everlyn would like to be able to reduce tuition costs for parents, and to become a charter school. Her vision is for Affirmation Academy to expand into a larger high school. 

In August of this year, Everlyn started making moves toward this vision and transported the school to a new and better site in Newark. The funds from this loan will help with the expenses of relocation.

loans.use: To fund the relocation of a longtime K-8 school in Newark

loans.name: Lady Mae

texts.en:
Lady Mae was born in 1995, is single and lives with her parents. She is a self-motivated and positive woman. She did very well in school and always dreamed of going to university. 

Lady Mae is studying for an associate degree in Information and Technology. Her parents have a fishing business, but having four children, their income is never good enough to cover her education costs. Instead, she is determined to finish in order to help the family in the future. 

She borrowed a loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC microfinance to pay for her university tuition. She hopes that in the near future, she will find a job and become successful.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Minjuur

texts.en:
Minjuur, 40 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

She has been working as a nurse in a hospital since 1995 and accumulated a vast amount of experience in taking care of various types of people. Her husband is a heavy truck driver in a mining company. Their three children go to high school. 

The apartment her family lives in has been deteriorating and needs some repair. So she is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to buy hardwood floors, vacuum insulated windows, fiberglass and wallpaper. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where energy is preserved and the less money will be spent on heating. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy hardwood floors, vacuum insulated windows and fiberglass.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 51 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jenelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. 

Jenelyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Jenelyn  would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Yokana

texts.en: Yokana, a married man with four children, is predominantly an agriculturalist with his main emphasis on cattle rearing. Apart from rearing them, Yokana also sells the cows to the cattle traders who transport them and sell them to the city abattoir. He has been able to get income since he sells those that are no longer producing enough milk and are a bit old. He will buy cows to breed and later sell. He is hard-working and wants his children to learn how to work hard and not depend on others.

loans.use: To buy cattle for fattening

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 20 years old and is studying for an associate degree in Information Technology. 

Her parents have a banana vending business and a shoe repair shop to make a living. She has four siblings that also need parental support, but Irene is grateful to her parents for the moral and financial support that they have always provided. 

Being a competitive professional is Irene's biggest wish. She will use this loan to pay the university fees for the first semester. She is hopeful to achieve all her ambitions in the future.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for the first semester.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Uranchimeg, 52 years old, lives with her husband and younger son in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. 

She has been working as a janitor at a private firm since her retirement in 2011. Her husband also retired from work but began working as a gate keeper at a high school. Their younger son is a high school student and the elder son lives separately from them. 

The Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) her family lives in has been deteriorating so she is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy felt and fiberglass to renovate her ger. After renovation, her family will burn less coal for heating, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution by releasing fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to buy felt and fiberglass.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Jocelyn has been raising livestock for 16 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins, feeds and other supplies for her livestock.

Jocelyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, feeds and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Sally Jane

texts.en:
Sally Jane is studying for an Associate degree in Information Technology at the university of Zamboanga del Sur. She lives with her parents and six siblings. 

Her mother sells longganisa (sausages) while her father works as a baker to make a living. She also helps her mother in the business during weekends to earn an extra income. 

This semester, she needs to pay the university fees. She borrowed a loan of 7,000 PHP  from GDMPC microfinance. She wants to help the family in the future.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for the first semester.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is studying for a Bachelor's degree in Elementary Education in the university of Zamboanga del Sur. She is 22 years old and lives with her family. 

Her father is a farmer and has been able to support their needs through faith and determination. She always finds ways to continue her studies for she believes that through this, she will be able to help her parents to augment their living. 

She borrowed a loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester. Divina hopes to find a job and become successful.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She is studying for an Associate in Information and Technology because she has a wish to augment their livelihood in the future. Both of her parents are earning with their business selling fish in the market. She awaits the time to come that she will able to get a job and thereby improve her standard of living and that of her family.

 Janeth  is requesting this loan in order to pay for her school tuition fees for the first semester, and thus continue studying.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for her first semester

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en:
Enkhjargal, 43, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. 

Enkhjargal has been working in interior decoration since 2000 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. Since she is well known for her skills in interior decoration, people are more likely to seek her service. Her husband has the position of serviceman in the police department. Their two children study at university. 

Enkhjargal is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Mongolian tughrik to pay her children's tuition fees. She and her husband think the best investment they can make for their children is to provide them the opportunity to get well-educated.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Lucile

texts.en:
Lucile works hard to support her family. Lucile is married and has a cellular phone shop business in the Philippines. Lucile has been in this business for three years now.

Lucile requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items of cellular phones and accessories to sell.

In the future, Lucile would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of cellular phones and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Daisy

texts.en:
Ma. Daisy is 28 years old and married. She has five children.

Ma. Daisy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like soft drinks, snack foods, canned goods, bread, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Ma. Daisy has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Ma. Daisy aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like soft drinks, snack foods, canned goods, bread, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 22 years old and married with one child. Michelle works very hard to provide for them.

Michelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, coffee, sugar, cream, soft drinks, fabric conditioner, etc. in her general store.

Michelle has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, coffee, sugar, cream, soft drinks, fabric conditioner, etc. 

Michelle would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, coffee, sugar, cream, soft drinks, fabric conditioner, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza, 34 is a woman living in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She's very hardworking and enthusiastic with a strong self-improvement drive. Due to poor economic resources, she has been unable to provide the needs for her children's future education. On her own initiative, Flordeliza works in her small grocery sales business, every day for about ten hours with great dedication and effort. She borrowed a loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit  to buy merchandise for her store. She is hopeful to improve the general living conditions of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia runs a general store in Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur to make a living. She has been doing this business as an aid to her husband's income from working as a carpenter. 

She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase canned goods and biscuits for sale. She was assured to have more income from her investments. She plans to use her profit to increase her working inventory capital for the improvement of her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and biscuits for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 53, is married and has four children. Two of her children are still in school.

Maria is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy feed and other supplies for her business.

Maria has been raising chickens for two years now and has borrowed from NWTF eight times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is 47 years old and has one child. Minerva is married and her child is in school.

Minerva is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccines, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Minerva has been raising livestock for 12 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Minerva would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Aida requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for 12 years now.

Aida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Radnaadagii

texts.en:
Radnaadagii, 30, lives with her husband and two children in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. She has been running a grocery store for a while. Her husband's profession is as an engineer at a mining company. Their two children go to high school. 

Radnaadagii is requesting a loan of 2,900,000 Mongolian tughrik to buy hardwood flooring, vacuum-insulated windows, fiberglass and cement to renovate her old house. After the renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into the air, contributing to efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, and owns and operates a retail store, selling animal feed and farm-related products. Rosita has been in her business for three years and earns 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. Aside from this, she also sells tobacco in the market during weekends to earn an extra income for the living. 

In 2011, Rosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Her previous loan from GDMPC that was used in her business was successfully repaid. Currently, Rosita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more tobacco leaves for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more tobacco leaves for sale

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 60 years old and widowed with two children. With one child still in school, Angelina works very hard to provide for them.

Angelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store. Angelina has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cooking oil, sugar, canned goods, coffee, and other groceries. 

Angelina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is a 33-year-old married man and a father of two children. He has been working in the agriculture sector for 13 years. Alla is a hard worker and specializes in growing palm trees. He is always climbing palm trees to harvest dates and sell them.
Alla takes good care of his production and ensures that every tree gets the care needed for high quality production. 
Alla will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, mainly organic, and renovate the storing facility for his production.  
Alla expects that the loan will help him generate additional income that will enable him to further develop his farm.
The story of Alla and his farm is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development working with its clients .

loans.use: to buy necessary fertilizers, and to renovate his farm.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.en:
Eliseo is married with 4 children and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur with his family. He has operated a general store for more than seven years and at the same time manages his business in the cafeteria to earn a living. 

His previous loan taken from GDMPC that was used in the business was successfully repaid. Recently, he borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for his cafeteria. He is hopeful to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for his cafeteria

loans.name: Ibtihal

texts.en:
Ibtihal is a young, 19 years old, ambitious, enthusiastic Iraqi woman with a keen eye for opportunities matched with skills and entrepreneur spirit to responds to needs.
Ibthihal is the owner of a beauty salon located in Iraq, in an area without beauty salons before she opened hers. She established the small but efficient salon 3 years ago and since then focuses all her efforts on making it a successful business.

She is a single woman with the full support of her family who are also very proud of her achievements and are watching her attentively to see what additional endeavors she will take on in the future. Success comes with some envy and jealously from others, but Ibtihal is unstoppable and is eager to become the best service provider and a respected woman business owner in the city.

With Ibtihal's great potentials to grow both personally and professionally, while improving her business as well, she qualifies for the WLIFT program and is taking a loan in the amount of 12,500 USD to use for the expansion of the current salon.

Continuing to recognize the lack of services available in her area, after establishing the salon she is now - with the financial support of the Relief International Microfinance Iraq SME loan -  adding a special service and area to her salon focusing on brides and weddings. She plans to expand the salon and also include an area used specifically for wedding pictures of the beautiful brides of her area.

Ibtihal aspires to become a successful business woman. Being under 30 years of age, she also qualifies for the category 'youth loan'

loans.use: to add a bridal studio to the beauty salon

loans.name: Heidelyn

texts.en:
Heidelyn is a 30-year-old, married woman from Trinidad, Bohol.  She has two children, five and two years old. Her husband works as a laborer to support their family. 

Heidelyn runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items, such as sugar, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, shampoo, and soap. She started her business almost two years ago.

She requesting a loan to buy rice, various dry goods, and beverages to maintain the store inventory.

In the future, Heidelyn would like to expand her business to improve their status of living and to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, various dry goods, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 57 years old, married, and has five children living with her in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. 

Nilda is engaged in raising pigs to make a living. She's been in this business for more than  five years and every month she earns PHP 19,000 from her business. 

In 2011, Nilda joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and her previous loan was used in this business and successfully repaid. 

Recently, she requested a new loan of PHP 25,000 to buy more piglets to raise and to renovate the livestock shelter.  

Nilda hopes to increase her income for the better future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and to renovate the livestock shelter.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 44 years old and married. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Anita has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase an additional unit of bicycle for her business.

Anita has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional unit of bicycle for her business.

loans.name: Analua

texts.en:
Analua is a 27-year-old, married woman with one child. 

She makes and sells rice and curry in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Analua needs a loan to buy rice, curry powder, chicken, garlic, onion, foam plates, and foil. She plans to use her profits to financially support her family. 

Analua joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2013.

loans.use: to buy rice, curry powder, chicken, garlic, onion, foam plates, and foil.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.en:
Aurelio is married and lives in San Carlos, Tukuran with his family. With his rice production, he was able to provide the family with a living. He has been doing this for more than 25 years, earning enough money for their needs. 

This season, after expanding his farm, Aurelio needs to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides for his rice fields. Without hesitation, he borrowed a loan of PHP 20,000 from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) which he had recently joined. 

He is hopeful of gaining more profit from his farm in return for his investments and effort.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides for his rice fields.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Bernardita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Bernardita has been in this business for ten years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Juntos Triunfaremos En Cocacharcra Group

texts.es: El grupo “JUNTOS TRIUNFAREMOS EN COCACHACRA” está  conformada por 8 socios y socias quienes  de dedica a diversas actividades del comercio minorista y a prestar servicios. Rosa tiene 39 años es conviviente con 02 hijos pequeños. Hace varios implemento su bodega en su vivienda en donde ofrece todos los productos de primera necesidad y a la vez vende productos de belleza. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, bebidas y una pequeña vitrina exhibidora en donde pueda mostrar sus productos de belleza. De esta manera Rosa apoya a su esposo con los gastos de su familia. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Rosa se encuentra sentada en el lado derecho.
texts.en:
The Juntos Triunfaremos En Cocachacra is a group that is comprised of eight members who work at different small business activities and provide services.

Rosa, age 39, is in a common-law marriage and has two small children.  Several years ago she set up her store in her house.  She offers all of the basic needs products, and she sells beauty products.

She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, and drinks.  She will also buy a small display case where she will be able to display her beauty products.  In this way Rosa helps her husband with the family expenses.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan that was provided.

Rosa is seated on the right.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and a small display case.

loans.name: Najmidin

texts.ru:
Начмидин более 10 лет проводит свое время на скотном дворе. И считает, что нашел свое любимое дело и видит в деятельности скотоводства одни плюсы. Первое из них то, что он любит и ладит с животными, это выгодное дело и самое главное он работает у себя дома, что позволяет не расставаться с близкими ему людьми. Начмидин отец шестерых детей. Все они еще ходят в школу, поэтому он один во всем справляется. Ему 45 лет и он еще в хорошей форме. Поэтому он одновременно занимается и растениеводством, в основном посевом риса и кукурузы. 
Сейчас Начмидин хочет закупить пару голов бычков, чтобы увеличить поголовья на скотном дворе. Он просит кредит для совершения такой покупки, что позволит ему в будущем иметь хорошую выгоду.
texts.en: Najmidin has been spending his time at a livestock yard for over 10 years.  He thinks that he found his favorite activity and sees only pluses in the animal husbandry business.  The first of these is the fact that he loves animals and gets along with them.  It is also a profitable business and the main benefit is that he works at home, which means that he does not have to leave his loved ones.  Najmidin is a father of six children.  All of them still attend a school, and this is why he handles everything himself.  He is 45 years old and still in good shape.  This is why he is concurrently involved in agriculture, primarily in sowing rice and corn.  Currently, Najmidin wants to buy a pair of bulls in order to increase the headcount at the livestock yard.  He is requesting this loan to make this purchase, which would allow him to have a good profit in the future.

loans.use: to buy a pair of bulls in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is a 53-year-old woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married, with eight children. The youngest child is 10. Her husband is a fisherman and helps support their family. 

Josefa  goes farming. She grows and sells rice to earn a living. Her business started two years ago. Aside from farming rice, Josefa also runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells goods, like noodles, sugar, coffee, soap, and condiments. 

She is asking for a loan to buy one sack of rice, one sack of pig feed, and various other goods for the store.

In the future, Josefa would like to expand her business and increase her business profitability to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy one sack of rice, one sack of pig feed, and various other goods for the store.

loans.name: Edeline Joy

texts.en:
Edeline Joy is studying Bachelor in Elementary Education at Lasalle University in Ozamiz City. Her determination in pursuing her dreams helped her to compete in school activities. She has four siblings who need parental support, too. 

This semester, Edeline Joy needs to pay the university fees for the first semester. She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and borrowed a loan of PHP 14,000 to cover the costs. 

Edeline Joy is hopeful of finding success in the future and to be able to augment her family's living.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su compañero de vida y su hija en casa propia, ella se dedica  al cultivo de maíz y a la venta y crianza de pollos y patos desde hace varios, tiene clientela fija que la buscan porque sus productos son buenos y los precios accesibles, con lo que gana de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su compañero de vida logran solventar los gatos que se les presentan, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  concentrado y vitaminas para los animales y así poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client lives with her life partner and her daughter in her own house.  She has been growing corn and raising and selling chickens and ducks for several years.  She has fixed clientele who seek her out because her products are good, and the prices are affordable.

With what she earns from her sales, and with the help of her life partner, they manage to pay for their expenses.

The client is requesting a loan to buy concentrated feed and vitamins for the animals.  This way she will be able to continue with her business.  It is her only source of work and of giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed and vitamins for the animals.

loans.name: Saidjon

texts.ru: Саидчон молодой и энергичный человек. Ему 18 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Саидчон учился в русскоязычной  школе. Он любил такие предметы как математика, информатика и английский язык. Саидчон в школе был ответственным и честным. Все его учителя были довольны его учебой. После успешного окончания средней школы, он поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Коммерции по специальности Экономическая информатика. Саидчон старается и в университете учится отлично и быть примерным студентом. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Saidjon is a young and energetic man.  He is 18 years old.  He is not married and lives with his parents.  Saidjon attended a Russian-speaking school.  He loved such subjects as mathematics, informatics and English language.  Saidjon was responsible and honest in school.  All of his teachers were satisfied with his studies.  After successfully graduating from a secondary school, he was accepted to the Tajikistan State Commerce University with the major of Economic Informatics.  Saidjon tries to study well in the university as well and be an exemplary student.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 800 US dollars to pay for his tuition.  He awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a shell craft business in the Philippines.

Cornelia requested a 17000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional shells, nylon thread and other raw materials for her business.

Cornelia has been in this business for 40 years now.

Cornelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional shells, nylon thread and other raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas, 31, is married, has one child, and is a hairdresser, a profession he had a dream of undertaking from the time he was young. He came to Sorocaba and started his business with very little. His business income isn't enough, because he has to do the necessary maintenance and decoration of his shop, that’s why he needs the loan.
