texts.es: doña carlota vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de comales de barro desde hace varios años, posee clientela ya establecida por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir algunos  gatos del hogar, doña carlota está solicitando un crédito para la compra de barro por mayor y demás herramientas que ella utiliza para la elaboración de los comales ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo  y así poder seguir llevando el pan diario a su hogar.
texts.en: Carlota lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She has worked for several yeas making comales [flat griddles] out of clay and selling them. She has an established customer base, thanks to the quality of her product and her good prices. With the proceeds from her sales and with her husband's help, they are able to cover some of the household expenses. Carlota is requesting a loan to buy clay on a wholesale basis as well as additional tools which she uses to make her comales. This is her only source of work, and thus she will be able to keep providing the daily bread for her household.

loans.use: to buy clay on a wholesale basis and additional tools.

loans.name: Arben

texts.en:
Arben is of Ashkali ethnic background. He is a married father of two children, ages 1 and 3 years old, living in Kosovo. 

He currently works as a field worker for a private company and he is the family's main source of income. Along with his wife and children, Arben is living in the same house with his parents. They are very poor and live under extremely poor and unhealthy conditions. Arben’s family always feels cold and gets sick in winter due to the cold and wet weather since they have a problem with their home's roof and windows. 

Arben has requested a loan to renovate his house by buying new windows, putting a new facade on the home, and repairing the roof. He hopes this loan will improve the health of his family and Arben is very grateful to the lenders for improving the family's conditions and standard of living. He promises that he will pay punctually.

loans.use: to renovate his house by buying new windows, putting a new facade on the home, and repairing the roof.

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is married and has one school-going child. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, Mgeni has operated a poultry business. Selling to her neighbours and passersby, her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With this Ksh 45,000 loan, Mgeni will purchase chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Sol Radiante -Wimpillay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL RADIANTE -WIMPILLAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mirina ella es conviviente y tiene 42 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 p.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar sillas y mesas para su restaurant.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de restaurant, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de transporte.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Sol Radiente - Wimpillay Communal Bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.
Mirina is 42 and lives with her partner. She has three children and runs a restaurant. She prepares different dishes such as potato, soup, and salted meat. She works from 10:00 am to 5:00 pm and has had this business for seven years. It is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her business. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of tables and chairs for her restaurant.
The group members inserted into the photo had their photo taken afterwards; they requested permission to do so for work reasons.
The other members sell clothing, run restaurants, sell groceries, and work in transportation.
Mirina thanks those who will become part of this dream through this loan and promises to repay her quotas as established.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a divorced woman with two school-going children. The family lives in their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Khadija has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past 13 years. Selling from home to her neighbors, she dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future. In addition, she has rental houses and makes juice to sell.

With this Kshs 100,000 loan, Khadija wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes and fruits for her enterprise. She decided to join Yehu for business financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир – из Виноградово. У него 3 своих теплицы: 2 по 3 сотки, и одна – 5 соток. Владимир занимается выращиванием цветов и помидор в парниках. У него есть наемные рабочие, которые работают у него в теплицах в сезон посева и сбора урожая. В этом тепличном бизнесе задействована вся семья. 
Владимир хочет до начала нового сезона приобрести все необходимое для работы в теплице, а именно удобрения, пленку, семена, а также сделать небольшой ремонт теплицы. Для этого ему необходима сумма в размере 20 000 гривен. Полученную прибыль Владимир надеется вложить в строительство собственного дома, в который семья сможет со временем переехать.
texts.en: Vladimir is from Vinogradovo.  He owns three greenhouses: two of them are three sotkas in size and one is five sotkas.  Vladimir is involved in growing flowers and tomatoes in greenhouses.  He has employees who work in his greenhouses during the sowing and harvesting seasons.  His whole family is involved in this business.  Before the start of the new season, Vladimir wants to purchase everything necessary for greenhouse work, specifically fertilizers, plastic, seeds and also to make small repairs in a greenhouse.  He needs a loan in the amount of 20,000 hryvnia for this.  Vladimir hopes to invest the resulting profit in building his own house, to which his family could move in-time.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, plastic and make repairs in a greenhouse

loans.name: Ramata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois Nouvellement inauguré, ce 26 septembre 2013 est composé de femmes très dynamiques, elles désirent apporter un changement dans leurs conditions d’existence raison pour la quelle elles ont intégré le programme des bancs villageois. Elles vivent dans un même village depuis plusieurs décennies et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce accompagné de la culture sous pluie. 

Madame Ramata, âgée de 33 ans (debout à l’extrême gauche), est la représentante de ce groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 filles et un garçon. Elle fabrique et vend des tenues traditionnelles plus particulièrement des pagnes faits à la main.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte se procurer d’un lot de files d’une valeur de  30 000 F CFA pour la confection de pagne, qu’elle revend à 5 000 F CFA pour 02 mois.

Avec  les bénéfices, elle veut développer son activité et participer de manière active à la gestion des charges de la famille.
texts.en:
This newly inaugurated "banc villageois", created on 26th September 2013, is made up of dynamic women wishing to bring about change in their living conditions. It is for this reason that they started up this "banc villageois". They have been living in the same village for several decades. They support each other through collectivism and mutual assistance. Their main source of income is a whatever business they can find in this struggling country.

33-year-old Ramata (the woman standing at the end of the row on the left in the photo) is this group's representative. She is a married mother of two girls and a boy. She creates and sells traditional dresses, notably hand-made "pagne" cloth.

With this new loan, she wants to buy 30,000 FCFA's worth of thread for the construction of traditional "pagne" cloth, which she will resell at 5,000 FCFA over a period of two months.

With the profits, she wants to develop her business and actively participate in managing her family life.

loans.use: to buy 30,000 FCFA's worth of thread for the construction of traditional pagne cloth, which she will resell at 5,000 FCFA over a period of two months

loans.name: Bouya's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois nouvellement  inauguré ce 18 septembre 2013 est composé de  femmes ayant un vœu ardent d’intégrer le programme de bancs villageois. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs années et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide mutuel. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la culture vivrière sous pluie. 
 
Madame Bouya (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe, Elle est mariée, âgée de 25 ans et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 filles et 01 garçon. C’est une femme très dynamique, elle s’active dans la transformation des produits locaux plus particulièrement la patte d’arachide. Elle achète la graine par sac de 50 kilos aux alentours de 15 000 F CFA le sac, fait la transformation pour revendre la patte par sceau de 5 à 20 kilos pour des prix variant de 5 000 à 17 000 F CFA selon le marché.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, lui permettra d’acheter au moins de sacs de graines d’arachide décortiquées pour la transformation. 

Les bénéfices, elle compte agrandir ses activités d’une part et d’autre part participer à la prise en charge scolaire des enfants.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" newly inagurated this September 18, 2013 consists of women who have a fervent wish to join the "banc villageois" program. They have all lived in the same village for several years and sustain relationships of solidarity and helping each other. Their main business is small shops and food crops in the rain.

Madam Bouya (standing to the extreme right with one hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married, 25 years old and mother to 3 children of whom 2 are girls and 1 is a boy. She is a very dynamic woman who transforms local products more specifically ground nut paste. She buys the seeds by 50 kilogram bags for around 15,000 FCFA per bag, transforms them to resell the paste in 5 to 20 kilogram buckets for prices ranging from 5,000 to 17,000 FCFA according to the market.

This new loan will allow her to buy more bags of ground nut seeds hulled for transformation.

With the profits she plans partly to expand her businesses and partly to contribute to the children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more bags of ground nut seeds hulled for transformation.

loans.name: Kondiougou 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  KONDIOUGOU 7 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme  Faty Bocar  debout en cinquième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village, de Ondougou et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 23.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales: nourriture, scolarisation des enfants et la santé et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Kondiougou 7 group are married women who, on average, are 47 years old, have 4 children, and live in polygamous families in Bandiagara in the 5th administrative region of Mali. 

They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to see their farming activities through the rainy season. This is their first loan with the institution.

They are primarily growing onions with Madame Faty Bocar standing fifth from the left in the photo. With her loan, she would like to buy seeds and fertilizer. They sell their crops after the harvest in the villages of Ondougou and Bandiagara to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She would like to earn a profit of 23,000 FCFA by the end of the farming season. This profit will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses: food, schooling for their children, and health. She will reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kondiougou 8 Group

Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 24.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales: nourriture, scolarisation des enfants et la santé et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.

They are primarily growing onions with Madame Salmatou Amadou standing at the far left in the photo. With her loan, she would like to buy seeds and fertilizer. They sell their crops after the harvest in the villages of Ondougou and Bandiagara to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She would like to earn a profit of 24,000 FCFA by the end of the farming season. This profit will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses: food, schooling for their children, and health. She will reinvest the rest in her business.

Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 24.500  Francs CFA en fin de campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales: nourriture, scolarisation des enfants et la santé et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.

They are primarily growing onions with Madame Safiatou seated at the far left in the photo. With her loan, she would like to buy seeds and fertilizer. They sell their crops after the harvest in the villages of Ondougou and Bandiagara to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She would like to earn a profit of 24,500 FCFA by the end of the farming season. This profit will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses: food, schooling for their children, and health. She will reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.name: Kondiougou 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  KONDIOUGOU 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé ont été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme Anta Hama assise en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village, de Ondougou de Bandiagara et Mopti, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 45.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales: nourriture, scolarisation des enfants et la santé et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Kondiougou 1 group are married women who, on average, are 45 years old, have 4 children, and live in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the 5th administrative region of Mali. 

They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to see their farming activities through the end of the rainy season. This is their second loan with the institution, and their previous loan was repaid. 

They are primarily growing onions with Madame Anta Hama who is seated second from the left in the photo. With this loan, she would like to buy seeds and fertilizer. They sell their crops after the harvest in the villages of Ondougou, Bandiagara, and Mopti to clientele composed of men and women.

She would like to earn an income of 45,000 FCFA by the end of the farming season. This income will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses: food, schooling for their children, and health. She will reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Yotamu

texts.en: Yotamu is 43 years old. He is a father of four children aged between 8 and 18. He wants the loan to buy more stoves for sale.The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more stoves to sell.

loans.name: Wenceslao

texts.es: Don Wenceslao, tiene 59 años de edad, está casado, tiene cinco hijos y vive en el municipio de Protección, Santa Bárbara. Tiene 40 años dedicándose a la agricultura. Sus cultivos son de café, maíz y  frijol. la producción que saca la vende en la zona donde vive. El préstamo que solicita es por 8,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de la finca de café. Estas actividades son su fuente de ingresos. Tiene como meta seguir trabajando para mejorar las condiciones de vida en la familia.
texts.en: Wenceslao is 59 years old, he is married, has five children and lives in municipality of Protección, Santa Bárbara. He has worked in agriculture for 40 years. His crops are of coffee, corn and beans and he sells the produce he harvests in the area in which he lives. The loan that he is seeking is for 8,000 Honduran Lempiras and he will invest it in the purchase of supplies and fertilizers to maintain the coffee holding. These activities are his source of income. His aim is to continue working to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to maintain the coffee plantation.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, a 26-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol, is the married mother of four children ranging in age from seven years to five months. Her husband is a fish vendor who supports their family, while she has been growing and selling rice to earn a living for five years. 

Marilyn is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers (such as urea at atlas) and insecticides to improve her harvest. In the future, she hopes to expand her farming business and increase business profitability for the sake of her children’s education and to achieve a good living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers (like urea at atlas)  and insecticides

loans.name: Mirjana

texts.en:
Mirjana lives in a small village in one of the minority areas of Kosovo. She is 39 years old and a mother of two children, ages 12 and 13 years old. 

Mirjana is a hardworking woman who works a lot in order to earn a living for her family. She runs an agricultural business together with her husband, using a tractor to provide seasonal agricultural services for a fee to local farmers. They also plant corn and wheat to sell. 

Currently, they are in need of a loan so that she can buy a new tractor IMT 533. With this loan she will be able to continue their business and hopes to generate even more income with a new, more effective and efficient tractor. In the future she does hope to expand and increase their business and income. She would like to thank all of the lenders at Kiva for their kindness and generous support.

loans.use: To buy a new tractor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock by buying one big box of tomatoes to resell in five days to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Imanli

texts.en:
Imanli is 20 years old. He lives with his parents and six brothers in Baku city. He is a third year student studying at Cooperation University. Imanli is a good student and reads many books. He is planning to work in his field of study after graduation to help his parents financially. 

His parents are facing financial problems which are not helping them to pay for his university fees. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN. Imanli awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees in advance and complete his studies successfully.

loans.name: Jamilya

texts.ru:
Джамиля 22-летняя молодая замужняя женщина с одним ребенком. Она около 3 лет занимается выпечкой лепешек в своем городе Душанбе. Печет лепешки на национальной печи - танур(tanur). Джамиля сначала готовит тесто, потом дает ему настоят. Далее делит на кусочки и раскатывает, потом лепит их на стенках пламенной печи. На фотографии сама Джамиля, сзади нее Вы можете увидеть танур и перед ней ее лепешки. 
   Скоро праздник и все жители накрывают на стол в ожидании гостей. Джамиля хочет на деньги от кредита приобрести несколько мешков муки, чтобы побольше испечь лепешек. Национальные лепешки это самое главное на праздничном столе. Для таджиков хлеб и пшеница ценное достояние это то, что их кормит. Джамиля будет очень рада, если праздничный стол будет украшать ее лепешки.
texts.en: Jamilya is a 22 year-old young, married woman with one child.  She has been involved in baking flatbread in her city of Dushanbe for about three years.  She bakes flatbread in a national oven - tandoor.  Jamilya first prepares the dough and lets it sit.  Then she divides it into pieces and rolls them flat, and then attaches them to the walls of the fire oven.  The photograph shows Jamilya and behind her you can see the tandoor and flatbread in front of her.  A holiday is approaching soon, and all residents will set up tables to treat guests.  Jamilya wants to purchase several bags of flour with the loan money in order to bake more flatbread.  National flatbread is the main dish on a holiday table.  For Tajiks, bread and wheat are valuable sources of food.  Jamilya will be very happy if her flatbread decorates holiday tables.

loans.use: to buy several bags of flour to make flatbread

loans.name: Kondiougou 10 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  KONDIOUGOU 10 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme Sogo  B. debout en 4 eme position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village, de Ondougou et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 25.500  Francs CFA en fin de campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales: nourriture, scolarisation des enfants et la santé et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.

They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to see their farming activities through the end of the rainy season. This is their first loan with the institution.

They are primarily growing onions with Madame Sogo B. standing fourth from the right in the photo. With her loan, she would like to buy seeds and fertilizer. They sell their crops after the harvest in the villages of Ondougou and Bandiagara to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She would like to earn a profit of 25,500 FCFA by the end of the farming season. This profit will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses: food, schooling for their children, and health. She will reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi est un jeune homme âgé de 33ans. Il est marié à une couturière et a un enfant âgé de 3ans. Il exerce comme activité la vente des produits d´alimentation générale à tous types de personnes. Il exerce son activité à la maison avec un employé et ne rencontre aucune difficulté. Il sollicite son premier prêt chez WAGES pour renforcer son activité afin d'ouvrir une seconde boutique. Il a démarré en 2006.
texts.en: Koffi is a young 33 year old male. He is married to a seamstress, and has a three year old child. He has had a business selling general food products to all types of clientele. He sells these products from his home with the help of one employee and does not have any difficulty in doing so. He is asking for his first loan from WAGES in order to reinforce his activity and open a second shop. He began this in 2006.

loans.use: purchase additional food products

loans.name: Adalicia

texts.es: Adalicia de 34 años de edad, vive con esposo y sus tres hijos de 17, 14 y 13 años de edad en casa propia, La señora Adalicia es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y muy emprendedora, desde a hace 7 años se dedica a la  crianza y venta de ganado en la zona donde reside, tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y vacunas para el ganado y ajustar para la compra de un ternero que le permita crecer en el negocio. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita
texts.en: Adalicia, 34, lives with her husband and three children aged 17, 14, and 13 years old in their own home. Adalicia is a hardworking, responsible and very enterprising woman, for the last seven years she has been making a living rearing and selling cattle in the area in which she lives. She has a very good customer base as she has known how to win her customers' confidence. She offers quality and good prices; she decided to invest in the care of her cattle as this is what her business depends on. This is why she is seeking a loan to buy vitamins and vaccines for her cattle and cover the costs of buying a calf which will enable her to grow the business. With this she hopes to obtain good profits and continue giving her family the financial support which it needs so much.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and vaccines for cattle and cover the costs of buying a calf.

loans.name: Femme De L'avenir Group

texts.fr:
Mme KORTIMI est la représentante du groupe FEMME DE L’AVENIR. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Le plus âgé a vingt trois (23) ans et le moins âgé a cinq (05) ans. Tous les quatre enfants vont à l’école. Elle a trois (03) personnes en charge.
Mme est restauratrice depuis trois (03) ans. Elle s’approvisionne à la grande boutique de son quartier. Ses clients sont essentiellement les gens de son quartier.
Mme veut s’acheter 02 sacs de riz, 02bidons d’huile de 20l.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices pour clôturer son restaurant. Elle ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Kortimi is the representative of the group "FEMME DE L’AVENIR".  She is married and the mother of four children who all attend school.  Her oldest child is 23 years old and her youngest is 5.  Kortimi supports three additional people.

Kortimi has been running a small restaurant for the past three years.  She buys her supplies at a local large store.  Most of her customers come from her neighborhood.

Kortimi wants to buy two bags of rice as well as two 20-liter oil cans.  She wants to save her profits in order to enclose her restaurant.  Her goal is to expand her activity and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two bags of rice and two 20-liter oil cans.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 25-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with three children aged five, four and one year old respectively. Her husband grows rice to support their family. She raises and sells pigs to help augment the income of their household. She started raising pigs almost one year ago. She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed, to improve the growth of the pigs in order to sell them on time.

In the future, Myrna would like to expand her hog-raising business and increase business profitability for her children’s education and well being as well.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 45-year-old married woman living with her seven children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has two rickshaws which he has given to his younger brother to operate for daily wages. 

Unfortunately, both rickshaws now require major maintenance and repair, for which Yasmeen has requested a loan on behalf of her husband. Yasmeen is very thankful to both Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: pay for the maintenance of auto rickshaws.

loans.name: Klever  Ramon

texts.es:
Klever tiene 25 años vive en casa de un pariente cercano en un pequeño recinto llamado la Armenia en Nanegalito ubicado al noroccidente de Quito. Él vive el día a día trabajando en una finca como ordeñador, es soltero no tiene hijos viene de una familia humilde de bajos recursos sus padres le dieron la educación de acuerdo  a sus posibilidades, por lo que pudo aprobar hasta los tres primeros años de colegio, el obstáculo que tuvo cuando quiso retomar sus estudios, fue un accidente en moto que lo imposibilitó inclusive  de trabajar por un tiempo determinado, pues cuando estuvo curado el trabajo que tenía ya estaba ocupado. En la actualidad tiene un trabajo con un horario muy extenso trabaja en dos turnos uno en la mañana de 3 am a 11am y otro en la tarde de 3:30pm a 7pm lo cual no le permite estudiar.
Su más grande sueño es tener su propio negocio, que le genere un buen ingreso económico y que le de más tiempo libre para poder terminar sus estudios.  Klever solicita un préstamo con el que hará posible cumplir su sueño, pues lo invertirá en emprender su negocio de una granja de pollos “pio”. La idea de este negocio nació porque en el sector hay muchos restaurantes que su especialidad es los caldos y secos de pollo, los mismos que serían el mercado potencial para este hombre emprendedor. Klever tiene mucho conocimiento del negocio, porque cuando era niño ayudó a su padre en la pequeña granja que tenían y se convirtió en un experto en el tema de la crianza. 
Klever agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por la oportunidad brindada para cumplir su sueño y principalmente por creer en su espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en:
Klever, 25, lives in a relative's home in a small neighborhood called Armenia in Nanegalito in northwestern Quito. He lives day to day milking cows at a farm. He is single, has no children, and comes from a modest, low-income family. His parents gave him an education commensurate with his future, which meant he was able to finish the first three years of school. An accident prevented him from going back to school or even working for a period of time. When he recovered, his former job had been filled. He now has a job that requires working in two shifts--one from 3 a.m. until 11 a.m. and the other from 3:30 p.m. until 7 p.m.--which doesn't allow him time to study.

His biggest dream is to have his own business that would generate good income and allow him more free time to finish school. Klever has applied for a loan to make that dream possible. He will invest to start a chicken farm. This business idea was born from the fact that there are many restaurants in the area that sell chicken soups and stews and would be the potential market for this enterprising man. Klever knows a lot about the business because, when he was young, he helped his father on their small farm and became an expert in raising animals. 

Klever thanks Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for giving him the chance to realize his dream and for believing in his entrepreneurial spirit.

loans.use: to build chicken pens.

loans.name: Alba Rosmery

texts.es: Alba, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Trinidad, Santa Bárbara. Anteriormente trabajaba en una farmacia y allí adquirió mucha experiencia. Hace 4 años decidió por tener su propio negocio de venta de medicinas como ser, penicilina, acetaminofén, amoxicilina, ibuprofeno, jarabe para tos, toallas sanitarias, vitaminas etc. El préstamo que solicito es por 15,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de mas medicamentos para la venta como ser pastillas de toda clase, jarabes, vitaminas, inyecciones y otros. Su objetivo es tener mas inventario  y así poder obtener mejores ganancias. Su sueño es llegar a tener su propia farmacia, y poder darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alba is 46 years old, she is a single mother and has two children, and lives in the municipality of Trinidad, Santa Bárbara. She used to work in a pharmacy and obtained a lot of experience there. Four years ago, she decided to open her own business selling medicines such as penicillin, acetaminophen, amoxicillin, ibuprofen, cough syrups, sanitary towels, vitamins and so on. 

The loan she is seeking amounts to 15,000 Honduran Lempiras and she will invest in the purchase of more medicines for sale such as all types of pills, syrups, vitamins, injections and others. Her aim is to have a larger stock and therein obtain better profits. Her dream is to have her own pharmacy and give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy medicines such as all types of pills, syrups, vitamins, injections and so on to sell.

loans.name: Fraternite Group

texts.fr:
Mme FANTA représente le groupe FRATERNITE. Elle est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants. Personne ne va à l’école et elle a 02personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Nouna. Ses clients sont les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter  15 ensembles pagnes.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut augmenter sa commande de pagnes. Mme ambitionne  ouvrir un magasin de pagnes et assurer la scolarité de ses 02 neveux.
texts.en:
Madame Fanta represents the group 'Fraternite'.  She is single and has no children.  She is financially responsible for 2 people, neither of whom go to school.  Madame Fanta has been selling pagnes (traditional wrap-around clothing) for 6 years.  She buys her supplies at the market in Nouna and her customers are women.  With this loan, she wants to buy 15 pagnes.  She will use her earnings to order more pagnes.  

Madame Fanta would like to open her own shop selling pagnes and be able to afford to send her 2 nephews to school.

loans.use: to buy 15 pagnes (traditional wrap-around clothing).

loans.name: Bobana

texts.en:
Bobana is 43 years old, divorced and a mother of an 18-year-old boy. Together, they both live with her elderly parents and she is the main source of income, working as a teacher in a primary school with a low salary while her son is a still a student. 

Bobana has a very old house and for many years she had hoped to be able to complete some renovations to it but was not able to do so. For the first time she is now requesting a loan so that she can get new insulation for the home before the winter weather so that she can keep her family warm and healthy as well as keep utility costs down. 

Her future goal is to be able to pay for better education of her son. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she would like to thank all of the lenders and she really appreciates this support to help her family.

loans.use: To pay for new insulation for her house before the winter.

loans.name: Allah Barka Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA représente le groupe ALLAH BARKA. Elle est mariée et n’a pas  d’enfant. Personne ne va à l’école et elle n’a personne en charge.
Mme transforme l’arachide en patte d’arachide et vend en même temps depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages. Ses clients sont les restauratrices.
Elle veut s’acheter ½ sac d’arachide.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut investir dans  son commerce. Mme ambitionne paye la scolarité de ses enfants  et faire de son activité une association.
texts.en: Aminata is the representative for the Allah Barka Group. She is married and has no children. She has no dependents, and no one attending school. Aminata has been turning peanuts into peanut paste, which she then sells, for the past eight years. She purchases her supplies in the local villages. Her customers are restaurateurs. With her loan, she wants to purchase half a sack of peanuts. With the income she earns, Aminata wants to reinvest in her business. Aminata's goal is to pay for her children's school fees, and to transform her business into an association.

loans.use: to purchase half a sack of peanuts.

loans.name: Sope Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Sope Mame Diarra regroupe huit femmes qui logent dans la même maison et qui sont parentés. Elles  font partis d’une grande association dans laquelle elles se faisaient de petits crédits tournants entre elles. Elles s’activent toute dans le petit commerce.
Elles ont comme responsable la dame Aminata, âgée de la cinquantaine, et qui  s’active dans le commerce de tissus depuis 1986. Avec cette période qui coïncide avec les fêtes de Tabaski, elle va pouvoir acheter des tissus, des chaussures, des draps de lit pour les revendre. 
Aminata est mariée et mère de famille, elle n’a pas de charge sinon ses propres besoins.
Elle a comme ambition de construire sa maison et de la mettre en location pour augmenter ses sources de revenus.
texts.en:
The Sope Mame Diarra loan group has eight female members who all live in the same house. They are all related, and are part of a large association where they all take turns to give each other small loans. All of the group’s members work in small-scale retail.

The group’s representative is called Aminata. She is around 50 years of age, and has worked selling fabrics since 1986. Right now, with the upcoming Tabaski festival, she will be able to buy fabric, shoes and bed linen for resale. 

Aminata is married and a mother, although she only needs to provide for herself. Her future plan is to build her own home, which she will then rent out to diversify her sources of income.

loans.use: To buy shoes, fabric and bed linen for resale.

loans.name: Safy

texts.fr: La dame Safy, est une habituée du guichet, elle vient pour la cinquième fois solliciter l’appui de l’IMCEC pour acheter de la marchandise .Elle s’active dans la vente de produits divers comme du savon, du parfum… Elle s’active aussi dans la vente du charbon de bois et du bois de chauffe. C’est d’ailleurs l’utilisation qu’elle va faire pour ce crédit. Madame Safy s’active depuis 2000 et a démarré avec un maigre revenu. Elle ne reste pas les bras croisés et participe à la gestion de la dépense quotidienne de la famille. Elle compte développer son activité si elle a les moyens et si son commerce marche bien, elle a l’intention de diversifier en faisant de l’aviculture.
texts.en:
Safy is a regular customer of one of the local branches of the UIMCEC.  It is the fifth time that she is requesting financial support from the UIMCEC, in order to buy some goods.  Safy is actively involved in the sale of various products such as soap and perfume.  She also sells charcoal and firewood, and she will be using her loan to buy this type of merchandise. 

Safy has been working in this field since 2000, initially making a very small income.  She always keeps herself busy and she contributes to the management of her family's daily expenses.  If she has the means to do it, she would like to develop her activity.  If her commercial activity is indeed doing well, she would like to diversify it by getting involved in poultry farming.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and firewood for resale, as well as soap and perfume.

loans.name: Preng

texts.en:
Preng is a 30-year-old married woman. She is a resident living in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She has planted rice crops on her existing farmland since she was single. She has a life partner with a noble farmer, and together they have two dependent children. She and her spouse have a good cooperation and they are able to make a net income of KHR 10,000 a day per each, with which she is able to cover their daily expenses. 

During this raining season, it’s a good time for them to plan their rice crop. To make their crop grow well, she needs enough farm supplies to apply to her rice crop. That is why she has applied for a loan to buy a few sacks of fertilizers and a water pump, which will be used to maintain the balance of water in the field needed for a good growth of their rice. This loan will help their family to get additional income from their current business.

loans.use: to buy a few sacks of fertilizers and a water pump.

loans.name: Relais Dolel Group

texts.fr:
Relais Dolel est un regroupement de relais communautaires qui ont fait parti des premiers adhérents du guichet d’IMCEC qui se trouve à la direction. Elles font du commerce de divers produits. 
La présidente, la dame Awa, qui lève la main sur la photo, est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 2 garçons et 2 filles. Elle évolue dans le commerce des ensembles pour enfants et des chaussures ; vu que c’est la période des préparatifs pour la fête de Tabaski, les commerçants se tournent vers la vente des habillements qui marchent bien. Elle a une expérience de cinq ans et si ce n’est la vente d’habillement, elle fait du commerce d’huile de palme. 
Grace au crédit, elle peut améliorer son activité et songer à construire sa maison.
texts.en:
Relais Dolel is an association of community representatives, who are among the first members of the IMCEC branch located at headquarters. The members do commerce in a variety of products. 

The president, Ms. Awa, with her hand is raised in the photo, is a married mother of four, 2 boys and 2 girls. She does commerce in shoes and children's outfits. Since the time is now for preparing for the Tabaski holidays, the merchants are turning toward selling clothing, which does well. Ms. Awa has five years of experience, selling clothing when not selling palm oil. Thanks to this loan, she can improve her business and consider building a house.

loans.use: to purchase children's outfits and shoes to resell

loans.name: Mikumi Group

texts.en:
Anjelina, who is in her early 40s, is married with five children who are still at school. She has been a food vendor for ten years now. She works from 6.00 am to 5.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Anjelina's 14th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a fridge, freezer, restock missing items in the food store and fabrics from Zaire. She has paid back all loans successfully.  She used the profit to buy a TV set, paid school fees, covered household expenses, bought a sofa set, a bed and a mattress. 

She will use this loan to buy backing flour, sugar, beans cooking oil, maize flour and charcoal. She dreams of building her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group 'Mikumi' with six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy baking flour, sugar, beans cooking oil, maize flour and charcoal.

loans.name: Deggo Liguel Liberte 2 Group

texts.fr:
Deggo Liguel est un regroupement de relais communautaires. Elles ont longtemps ouvert leur compte à l’IMCEC mais n’ont jamais eu à bénéficier de crédit parce qu’elles n’en avaient pas besoin et épargnait leur propre argent  dans le compte. Elles font du commerce de divers produits.
 Leur présidente, la dame Awa, elle, s’active dans la transformation des céréales locales depuis maintenant 3 ans. Elle est relais communautaire depuis huit ans. Avec l’argent, elle pourra acheter des céréales : du mil, du mais et le transformer en couscous ou » sankal « (dérivé du mil) pour ensuite le revendre. 
Madame Awa est mariée et mère de 7 enfants qui ont la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. Elle, elle ne fait que compléter quelque rare fois. Awa rêve de créer son entreprise personnel avec le matériel nécessaire pour faire la transformation, un bon conditionnement des produits et un marché pour la commercialisation.
texts.en:
Deggo Liguel is an association of community representatives. The members have had an account at IMCEC for a long time but never had to take out a loan, since they had no need, and they saved their own money in the account. They do commerce in a variety of goods. 

Their president, Ms. Awa, has been active in processing local grains for three years now. She has been a community representative for eight years. With the money, she will be able to purchase some grain (millet and corn) for processing into couscous or "sankal" (derived from millet) and then reselling the products. 

Ms. Awa is a married mother of seven children, who take care of the day-to-day expenses. She herself only rarely fills in. She dreams of establishing her own enterprise with the supplies and equipment necessary for processing grain, nice product packaging, and a market for making sales.

loans.use: to purchase grains to process and resell the final product

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which has a climate that is excellent for agriculture. He has four children and has been doing this farming work for three years. His primary income sources are milk and eggs.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Practicing mixed farming." His biggest challenge is: "Lack of capital." Animals on the farm have been given the names of: "Eto."

Jackson was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Because it insures assets."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required microfinance training session: "Group attendance."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked: "How will this loan benefit his family?," Jackson replied: "It will improve their livelihood."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jackson owns the following: 'cow and poultry,' but he does not own: 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile.' 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net and running water,' but he does not have: 'electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV or DVD.'

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Mor

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mor est chauffeur de profession depuis maintenant plus de 10 ans. Il est marié à deux femmes et a 8 enfants. Il vient solliciter pour une seconde fois un crédit qui servira à l’achat d’un moteur pour  son véhicule clando. Il conduit lui-même son véhicule et en tire sa dépense quotidienne, paie ses factures : téléphone et eau. Et peut aussi améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
Mor travaille de 8h à 20h et préfère ne pas trop travailler la nuit pour ne pas fatiguer le véhicule qui né pas trop en bon état. S’il avait les moyens, il se cherchera un autre  véhicule, c’est son ambition le plus pressant.
texts.en: Mr. Mor has been a professional driver for over ten years now. He is married to two women, and he has eight children. He is here to requested a second loan for purchasing an engine for his informal taxi. He drives it himself and thus can cover his day-to-day expenses and pay his bills: telephone and water. He can also improve his family's living conditions. Mr. Mor works from 8 AM till 8 PM and prefers not to work at night too much, so as to avoid wearing out his vehicle, which is not in very good shape. If he could afford it, he would look for another vehicle, which is his most urgent ambition.

loans.use: to purchase a motor for his informal taxi

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur IBRAHIMA est un jeune homme âgé de 35 ans qui évolue dans la couture. Il est marié et père de 3 enfants. Il sollicite ce crédit d'un montant de 150.000 F pour acheter une machine à coudre. IBRAHIMA a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans cet activité. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 20h. Il gère la facture d'électricité de son atelier et les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Comme projet futur il voudrait avoir plus d'argent pour pouvoir acheter plusieurs machines et satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: Ibrahima is a young, 35-year-old man who works as a tailor. He is married and the father of 3 children. He is requesting this 150 000 franc loan in order to buy a sewing machine. Ibrahima has been in this line of work for over 5 years. He starts his workday at 8am and stops at 8pm. He covers his studio's electricity bill and his family's daily expenses. In the future, he would like to have more money so that he can buy several sewing machines and satisfy his customer demand.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mansour

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mansour, un jeune de 34 ans, exerce le métier de soudeur depuis plus de 10 ans. Il est marié et a 3 enfants dont le plus âgé a 8 ans et le plus jeune, 6 mois. Il travaillait dans l’atelier de son oncle qui lui a appris le métier. Il s’est ensuite retiré pour  travailler seule et pouvoir mettre en pratique ce qu’il avait appris. Il sollicite un crédit afin de pouvoir acheter du matériel comme une moule et une perceuse avec quoi il travaille.
Il pense pouvoir améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille, commencé à épargner  afin de pouvoir ouvrir son propre garage et diversifier ses services.
texts.en: Mansour, a young 34-year-old man, has been a welder for over 10 years. He is married and has 3 children, the eldest of whom is 8 and the youngest, 6 months. He used to work in his uncle's workshop, where he learned the trade. He then left to work alone and exercise the skills he had learned. He is requesting a loan in order to buy material for his work, like a rack and a drill. He hopes to be able to improve his family's food conditions and to start to build his savings, so that he can open his own garage and diversify his services.

loans.use: to buy a rack and a hand drill for his soldering business.

loans.name: Diappo I Group

texts.fr: Le groupement DIAPPO I est constitué de 5 membres qui habitent le même quartier dont 4 femmes et un homme qui est le président. Il s’appelle Magueye, on le reconnait sur la photo par sa main qu’il a levée. Il évolue dans le commerce de bétail et a une expérience de  plus de 5ans dans son activité. Magueye a besoin de ce montant pour acheter des moutons les engraisser et ensuite les revendre sur la marché local .Il est marié et père de famille, il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 20h. Il souhait à l’avenir ouvrir une ferme  afin  de pouvoir diversifier son cheptel et augmenter ses revenus  ainsi il pourra dit-il améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: The Diappo I group has 5 members, 4 women and 1 man (the group leader), who all live in the same district. The group leader is called Magueye and has his hand raised in the picture. He has been running a livestock business for over 5 years. Magueye needs this loan in order to buy some sheep, fatten them and then resell them at the local market. He is married and a father. He starts his workday at 8am and finishes at 8pm. In the future, he would like to start a farm in order to diversify his livestock and increase his income, and therefore his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of livestock to sell during the winter to her customers.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is 20 years old. She lives with her family in the village of Dsegh which is in the Lori region. She is a very pretty and beautiful girl, who studies at the Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the department of Jurisprudence. She studies in the paid divisions. At the same time she works  as a Legal Adviser. Her mother works as a backer and her father is temporarily in the Russian Federation working abroad. Lilit tries to lighten the problems and financial difficulties of her family by working.

She asks for a loan of 175,000 Armenian drams in order to pay her tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate the roof of his home

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
From the town of Gyumri, where she lives with her mother, Marina has been providing manicure and makeup services to locals to earn her living for a number of years. As a result of hard work, she currently has a good client base who use her service with great pleasure. 

Marina's loan, which has already been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international, will enable her to purchase materials needed for her work. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Marina, and she will be very grateful to all the lenders.

loans.use: to buy materials for providing manicure and makeup services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay coffee cutters.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard lives in Gyumri town. She works at one of the local restaurants as a chef's assistant. 

As the salary she gets is barely enough for covering daily basic needs, Alvard is also involved in a retail business. She purchases clothing from the city market, and then sells it at neighboring villages. Over years of hard work, Alvard is already well known among customers for being a very good seller. Now, this enthusiastic woman needs financial support to be able to purchase a new stock of clothing to sell to customers.

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Alvard to purchase needed supplies and sell them to her customers.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing to sell to customers

loans.name: Farzana Group

texts.en:
Farzana is 36 years old, a hard-working and independent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has gone abroad for the purpose of his job as an argon welder and his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. 

For 15 years, Farzana has been running a beauty salon, and she wants to purchase some more cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon. For that reason, Farzana is a member of an three-person lending group that has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. 

On getting a profit, first of all she will repay the loan amount to Kiva and than she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is very congested. She hopes that her business will grow even more and she is very much thankful to both BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her salon.

loans.name: Andrea Concepcion

texts.es: Andrea se encuentra muy feliz ya que con su primera solicitud de crédito ella pudo comprar los insumos necesarios para dar asistencia a sus cultivos de café, pudiendo aprovechar el primer corte y venderlo a muy buen precio con el que obtuvo una excelente ganancia produciendo 50 quintales los cuales vendió a muy buen precio y pudo salir con su compromiso de crédito. Las ganancias fueron muy buenas y re invirtió en sus cultivos pudiendo comprar nueva chapola para poder cultivarla y poder ampliar más sus cultivos sembrando más variedad y teniendo en mente la visión de cubrir una mayor demanda incrementando la oferta actual.  Además ella pudo destinar un poco de capital para sus estudios ya que eso está en sus sueños y su mayor anhelo es cumplirlo. Su negocio tuvo un cambio porque mejoro su producción gracias al primer financiamiento como también su calidad de vida ya que los ingresos obtenidos eran los esperados y eso dio paso a poder seguir re invirtiendo en sus cultivos. Por lo que esta vez ha decidido solicitar un segundo crédito con el cual puedan cultivar la chapola que actualmente tiene en una mayor cantidad y poder preparar la tierra nuevamente para el nuevo producto ya que es necesario por el mantenimiento y protección de la misma para poder sacar buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Andrea is very happy as with her first loan – she was able to buy the supplies needed to support her coffee crops, meaning she was able to profit from the first harvest and sell at a very good price with which she obtained excellent profits. She produced 50 quintals which she sold at a strong price and was able to meet her loan repayments. The profits were healthy and she reinvested in her crops, managing to buy new seedlings to grow and increase her crops that bit more; sowing a larger variety, and keeping in mind the vision of covering a greater demand, increasing the current offer. 

In addition, she was also able to allocate a bit of money to her studies as this figures amongst her dreams and her greatest desire is to make it a reality. Andrea's business underwent a change because she improved her production thanks to the first loan, it also improved her quality of life as the income that she obtained was as hoped and this opened up the way to continue reinvesting in her crops. It is for this reason that this time she has decided to seek a second loan with which she will be able to sow the seedlings that she currently has in a large quantity, and prepare the land once again for the new product, which is necessary for the maintenance and protection of the crop in order to obtain good results.

loans.use: to prepare the land to grow new coffee seedlings.

loans.name: Osmildo

texts.es: Osmildo de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, él se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra como: hierro, aluminio, llantas, cobre, etc.  desde hace 5 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee clientela establecida que lo buscan por los buenos precios que ofrece, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra llevar el sustento diario a su hogar, él solicita el crédito para poder comprar más chatarra por quintales, una balanza y herramientas necesarias para poder seguir con su negocio que le genera buenas ganancias y así el podrá seguirle dando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Osmildo is 50 years old and lives in a house he owns with his family. He makes a living by buying and selling scraps like iron, aluminum, tires, copper, etc. His business has been located in his home for the last five years. He has an established clientele that seeks him out for the good prices he offers. With what he obtains from his business, he is able to sustain his home on a daily basis.

He is asking for the loan to be able to buy more scraps by the quintal, as well as a scale and necessary tools to be able to continue with his business, which generates good earnings. In this way, he will be able to keep giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more scraps by the quintal, as well as a scale and necessary tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his motorcycle and buy a tank, piston, rings, chain, tires, and seat.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is 34 years old, married and has two children aged three and eights years old. He lives with his family in a small village where the majority of the people are unemployed or generate income mainly through various agricultural means. Vladimir has supported his family for many years using a machine to cultivate and maintain the property and land of others. 

Recently his trailer has broken down and he has been unable to work or provide an income for his family. He is requesting a loan so that he will be able to pay for the costs of repairing the trailer on his tractor and begin to provide income again. He is very grateful to the KosInvest-Kiva lenders for the financial support given to his family.

loans.use: To repair the trailer of his tractor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his capital and buy many films and photo-printing paper to serve many clients and make more money.

loans.name: Pedra

texts.en:
Pedra is a 54-year-old woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with four children. The oldest is 23 while the youngest is 12. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like bread, eggs, seasonings, noodles, and canned goods. Her business started four years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy one sack of rice and two cases of soft drinks to fill her store with stocks and continue her livelihood activity.
In the future, she hopes to expand her retail store business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy one sack of rice and two cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Francisca Cleotilde

texts.es: Francisca se dedica a impartir clases de primaria en el colegio de la misma localidad donde vive, es soltera con 2 hijos a los que tiene el deber de proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo, la señora francisca tiene en la actualidad una necesidad prioritaria de ampliar su negocio. Por la necesidad misma se decidió visitar las oficinas de ceprodel para ser  beneficiada con un crédito y realizar  su objetivo que es el sueño de su vida, como es la ampliación de su negocio y dicho financiamiento lo utilizaría para compra de pacas de ropa usada., paca de ropa de niño, paca de blusas de mujer y varón, pacas de zapatos de hombre y mujer, y de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Francisca teaches at an elementary school in her neighborhood. She is single and has two children, to whom she provides all the things necessary for their development. Francisca is now primarily interested in growing her business. She came to the Ceprodel office to apply for a loan to achieve her objective and her life's dream to grow her business. She will use this loan to buy bulk used clothing, clothing for children, and blouses, shirts, and shoes for men and women so that she can earn more and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy bulk used clothing, clothing for children, and blouses, shirts, and shoes for men and women.

loans.name: Sorpresa Group

texts.es: El Grupo Sorpresa esta integrado por siete mujeres y un hombre, personas que hacen lo posible para que sus familias tengan una mejor calidad de vida, los integrantes son Doña Adelina, Juana, Leticia, Juliana, Benita, Hilaria,  Graciela  y Noé todos los integrantes han solicitado el crédito para invertirlo en borregos. El nombre del grupo lo eligió la señora Leticia o Lety quien platica que decidió ponerle este nombre al grupo ya que el día que la invitaron para solicitar crédito a la institución le llamo mucho la atención y para Doña Lety era una muy buena opción es por eso que fue de “Sorpresa” que llegaran a su casa a invitarla para solicitar crédito. Doña Lety tiene 39 años de edad está casada con el señor José desde hace 20 años y juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos que se encuentran estudiando, la señora Lety platica que se dedica a la elaboración de bordados, manteles y trajes típicos desde hace varios años. Ella comento “Inicie por necesidad, desde pequeña fui huérfana de madre y de alguna manera tenia que aprender un oficio para ayudar con los gastos de mis hermanos pero ahora con los gastos de mis hijos” Esta vez esta solicitando un crédito para manteles, estambres, hilos y tela, Doña Lety esta muy contenta y agradecida con VisionFund porque se ha convertido en una un apoyo económico para su familia. Aunque su dificultad más grande es la competencia no le pone mucha atención todo lo contrario trata de hacer lo mejor posible su trabajo para que sus clientas regresen a solicitar sus servicios como costurera, sus ganancias han sido muy buenas lo que le permitido mejorado su vivienda anteriormente Doña Lety no tenía un hogar propio vivía con sus padres pero ahora está muy contenta porque no solo ha logrado obtener su vivienda sino que además sus hijas se encuentran estudiando en escuelas privadas. Doña Lety y el resto del grupo están muy agradecidos con la institución y Kiva por el crédito otorgado y todos sus servicios como la capacitación y la bonificación que es muy buena sonriendo Doña Lety comenta “A mi la bonificación es un gran apoyo porque con ese dinerito puedo comprar zapatos, ropa etc.”
texts.en:
The Sorpresa (Surprise) group is made up of 7 women and one man who do whatever is possible to provide their families with a better quality of life.  The members are Leticia (Lety), Adelina, Juana, Juliana, Benita, Hilaria, Graciela, and Noé.  All the group members except Lety have asked for loans to use to buy lambs.  Leticia chose the name of the group because when she was invited to submit a loan request to VisionFund she was very impressed by it and it seemed like a great option for her.  For this reason, it was "surprising" to her when they arrived at her house to invite her to submit a loan application.

Lety is 39 years old and has been married to José for 20 years.  Together, they have formed a family and have 4 children, all of whom are currently in school.  Lety says that she has worked making embroidery, tablecloths, and basic clothes for several years.  She says that "I got started out of necessity.  I lost my mother when I was little and I had to somehow learn how to work so I could help support my siblings.  Now, I do the same thing but instead work to support my children."

Currently, she is asking for a loan so she can make tablecloths and buy wool yarn, thread, and fabric.  Lety is very happy and grateful to Vision Fund because they have become a financial support to her family.  Even though her greatest difficulty is competition, she doesn't pay it much mind.  To the contrary, she does the best work she can so her customers will return to solicit her services as a seamstress.  

Her profits have been very good and this has allowed her to improve her house.  In the past, Lety didn't have her own house and lived with her parents.  Now, however, she is very happy because she has not only been able to obtain her own house but has also been able to let her daughters study in private schools.

Lety and the rest of the group are very grateful to Vision Fund and to Kiva for the loans that they have been given and for all their services such as training and financial bonuses, which are very good.  Smiling, Lety says that "To me, the bonuses have been a great support because with that small amount of money I can buy shoes, clothes, etc."

loans.use: for tablecloths, yarns, threads, fabric and sheep

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 37-years-old married woman living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is expert in preparing betel leaf because he has been running this shop for many years and lot of customers like to eat betel leaf which is prepared by him. He sells betel leaf consisting of sweet ingredients, mints or tobacco as well. In addition to betel leaf he offers cigarettes of different brands as well. 

With the growth of business he wants to start selling cold drinks, soft drinks and mineral water. He wants to offer cold drinks also but he does not have refrigerator for the preservation of drinks and enough money as well.

Therefore, Yasmeen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can buy a refrigerator and cold drinks to sell. 

In this way he will be successful and win the trust of his customers and get excess income also. His family needs are growing day-by-day; he could easily cope and handle the critical situations easily. Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and hopes that the Kiva lenders will support her.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator to preserve cold drinks.

loans.name: Gbenondou-Pahou 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement GBENONDOU-PAHOU 1 est composé de vingt deux personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Philomène (est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo) âgée de 43 ans. Philomène n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Philomène est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Mathieu. Le couple a quatre enfants, aucun des enfants n'est scolarisés et sont tous à leur charge. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à sa charge. Philomène vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. C’est pour cette raison que depuis neuf ans, Philomène vend du maïs et du fromage à son domicile. Philomène s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans d’accroitre le niveau de son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Philomène ensemble avec les autres membres du GBENONDOU-PAHOU 1 sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The group Gbenondou-Pahou 1 is made up of twenty-two people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, named Philomène (the one with her hand raised in the photo), is 43 years old. Philomène did not attend school. With the objective of raising their business level in order to better meet the needs of their clientele, the group is requesting for the first time the financial support of ALIDé. Philomène is married to a driver by the name of Mathieu. The couple has four children, none of whom are in school and all of whom are in their care. Aside from their children, the couple cares for another child. Philomène lives with her husband and their children. The different needs of the household are taken care of by the couple. It is for this reason that for nine years, Philomène has sold corn and cheese from her home. Philomène stocks up in the market in Benin. In order to grow her level of business and make her clients happy, Philomène, together with the other members of Gbenondou-Pahou 1, requests a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase corn and cheese.

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en:
Mr. Natsagdorj, 30 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. He was decorating building interior components from 2006 to 2012. In 2012, he began to work in a building company as a full-time employee. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors, fiberglass and foam to renovate his house in preparation for the incoming winter. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and release less pollutants into the air, contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Domingo Antonio

texts.es: Domingo es un hombre dedicado a la protección de su  familia, labora en un centro de salud como técnico epidemiológico, es casado con un hijo pequeño al que le da el apoyo necesario para sus estudios  y cuido personal, este señor tiene la necesidad de mejorar su casa, por eso llego a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito el cual lo utilizará en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cemento, arena, zinc, perlines y el pago de mano de obra y lograr el objetivo planteado y de esa manera mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Domingo is dedicated to protecting his family.  He works in a health centre as a technician in the epidemiology department.  Domingo is married and has a young son, whom he gives the necessary support in order to look after and educate him.  Domingo needs to make improvements to his house and so has come to Ceprodel in order to apply for a loan to buy cement, sand, zinc, and purlins, and to pay labourers.  With this he can achieve his objective and improve his living conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, zinc, and purlins, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Concepción De La Cruz

texts.es: Concepción, es  una señora  que se desempeña como auxiliar de enfermería, con 9 años de experiencia de ejercer dicha labor, es  soltera, no tiene ninguna persona su  cargo.  Actualmente está presentando una necesidad de mejorar su viendo, por este motivo se presento a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento. El cual lo utilizara para compra de materiales de construcción  tales como arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra. Lo que vendría a tener mejores condiciones en su hogar y cumplir su sueño
texts.en: Concepción has been working as a nursing assistant for nine years.  She is single and has no children.  Concepción needs to make improvements to her home and so has come to the Ceprodel office to apply for a loan.  She will use the loan to buy building materials such as sand and cement, and to pay labourers.  This will help Concepción to have better living conditions at home and to achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as sand and cement, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, iron, and doors, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw material for making bread, such as flour, butter, sugar and yeast.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Musarat Jabeen Group

texts.en:
Musarat is an active 58-year-old woman with seven children, with all her children studying in school and college. Her husband is an energetic auto mechanic and also owns a workshop. Musarat has excellent embroidery skills, and she sells embroidered products at the market. Her husband works 17 hours a day, and the demands of his auto parts business are increasing day by day. 
Under the circumstances, Musarat and her husband are interested in expanding the auto parts workshop by purchasing some new parts. 
In this case, Musarat, as a member of a four-member group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase parts and expand her husband's business.
She is so grateful to BRAC and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy auto parts.

loans.name: Dorjpalam

texts.en: Mr. Dorjpalam, 30 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. He has been working as an automobile driver for a private firm since 2008. On his day off, he also provides taxi services to local people. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home looking after their children. He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, and doors. After installing these items into his house, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place. They will burn less coal and release fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to buy vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, and doors for his house

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som, aged 29, has been working in the farming business for many years in Battambang province. She has a few plots of farmland for planting rice and other seasonal crops such as beans, corn, and cassava. Som and her husband help each other maintain a high production in each harvest season. From this type of business, they can make a good profit which they often use to cover their family’s living expenses and send their three children to school. 
At the moment, she has requested a loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, for the purpose of building a latrine for household use. This will enable her to build a healthy family and protect her family members from unexpected illness. She appreciates all the help lenders provide to her whole family.

loans.use: to build a latrine for household use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medications, clinical exams, urine and blood tests, ultrasound, CAT, eyeglasses and other expenses.

loans.name: Barka

texts.en:
Barka is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business.
The previous loan enabled her to save money from her M-pesa services. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to invest in additional float (electronic credits to sell) for her M-pesa business.
She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain a level of profits that helped her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to invest in additional float (electronic credits to sell) for her M-pesa business.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He is married and has six children to support. His eldest is 18, and his youngest child is only three years old. He has a transportation business using his motorcycle, called a "habal-habal".

He is asking for a loan to buy tires and chains that will help him keep his motorcycle in good condition, so he can keep his business going. His income provides food and an education for his children.  

In the future, he hopes to have another business to help him in raising his family.

loans.use: to buy tires and chains

loans.name: Fitore

texts.en: Fitore is married, is 32 years old and has a 6-year-old daughter. Her husband works transporting and carrying goods for others as needed, and she stays at home caring for the house and their daughter. They are very poor and live under very bad conditions. Recently, the main door of her house has become broken and now the cold and rain have been able to enter the home. Fitore's husband does not earn enough of a salary to repair the door, so she is requesting a loan for a new one before the weather gets even worse. This loan will improve their living conditions, keeping them warm and healthy as well as decreasing or limiting their utility costs. Fitore hopes to find a job and secure a better life for her family. She is very grateful to all Kiva lenders for this support.

loans.use: To buy a new main door for her house

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
For eight years now, Lolita has farmed rice in the town of San Miguel. She is 42 years old, is married, and has seven children. It is quite a challenge for Lolita to wait for a few months before she can have her harvest while also providing for her children. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm so her crops will grow abundantly. 
Her income from farming provides food and school fees for her children.
In the future, she hopes to successfully send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbold, 29 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land.
